comment: Took him for CPE 3000 and if you can take him too. He is a great lecturer and makes topics very simple to understand, he does care about you learning and will go above and beyond to help you. Go to class and you'll do great in the class. The tests, labs, and homework's are all based off of what he teaches you.

Lectures for this course were extremely heavy with some of the modules containing over 100+ slides, but he tells you the important concepts to focus on. There were 2 exams, some homework, labs, final project, & a final. The project requires you to use all the sensors that you learn about in lab. While attendance isn't mandatory, I recommend going.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: 4010 is good with Tekes. He has a lot of information on his slides, but as long as you just listen to what he says/writes on the board then you won't get overwhelmed. Labs are fun for this course and not too challenging. HW isn't challenging either

I'm really surprised there's no reviews for his CpE 4010, but this is what my review will be towards. Honestly, really wish I took 4010 with someone else. Reads and depends on his slides, which are overbearingly long. Expect to memorize and not learn in this course, as that's how it's structured. Also, quizzes and tests are almost unfair.
Dr. Tekes does a good job at introducing CPE, and he has a lot of fun projects involving the Raspberry Pi computers. He has a lot of knowledge and he is an understanding guy who is very helpful.

Dr. Tekes is an overall very good professor, he explains topics well, and really breaks stuff down. He has realistic expectations and the tests are all fair. He also makes sure that you do well, at one point he did a makeup midterm when I thought the average was alright.

I had Dr. Tekes for EE 4201 Control Systems and he is very good professor. Control systems is a hard subject but I think I was able to learn a lot from him. Gives feedback and replies emails on time, and he cares about his students. Attend his lectures and ask questions if you have any. Very respectful. Tests are doable. I wish I had him for EE3501

Very hard class but he made it tolerable. There were hw, labs, tests, project, and a final, and 5% bonus which is attendance he takes randomly some days. He will help you out if you don't understand something, so don't hestitate to ask.
Professor Tekes is a really fair professor. What you put into the class, you will get out.

He is new to teaching. He's a nice Professor and will help you out. He double check your exams before you submit it to make sure at least doing the problem correctly and tells you to go redo the problem. The class is really boring because he'll read off the lecture slides and rarely does examples, but when he does examples it helps.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria
